org.spongepowered.api.data.manipulators

Interface MobSpawnerData

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<MobSpawnerData>, DataManipulator<MobSpawnerData>, DataSerializable

    public interface MobSpawnerData
extends DataManipulator<MobSpawnerData>
    Represents the data associated with a mob spawner, including the spawn delay, the spawn count, and the list of possible entities that can be spawned.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • getRemainingDelay

        short getRemainingDelay()
        Gets the remaining delay until the next batch of monsters is spawned.
        Returns:
        The remaining delay, in ticks

      • setRemainingDelay

        void setRemainingDelay(short delay)
        Sets the remaining delay until the next batch of monsters is spawned. Setting this to zero will cause the monsters to be spawned upon the next tick.
        Parameters:
        delay - The new delay, in ticks

      • getMinimumSpawnDelay

        short getMinimumSpawnDelay()
        Gets the minimum delay between batches of monsters.

        Each time the timer is reset the new delay is chosen randomly from between the minimum (inclusive) and maximum (exclusive) delays.

        Returns:
        The minimum delay, in ticks

      • setMinimumSpawnDelay

        void setMinimumSpawnDelay(short delay)
        Sets the minimum delay between batches of monsters.

        Each time the timer is reset the new delay is chosen randomly from between the minimum (inclusive) and maximum (exclusive) delays.

        Parameters:
        delay - The new minimum delay, in ticks

      • getMaximumSpawnDelay

        short getMaximumSpawnDelay()
        Gets the maximum delay between batches of monsters.

        Each time the timer is reset the new delay is chosen randomly from between the minimum (inclusive) and maximum (exclusive) delays.

        Returns:
        The maximum delay, in ticks

      • setMaximumSpawnDelay

        void setMaximumSpawnDelay(short delay)
        Sets the maximum delay between batches of monsters.

        Each time the timer is reset the new delay is chosen randomly from between the minimum (inclusive) and maximum (exclusive) delays.

        Parameters:
        delay - The new maximum delay, in ticks

      • getSpawnCount

        short getSpawnCount()
        Gets the number of monsters that will attempt to spawn with each batch.

        The actual number of monsters spawned may be less than the attempted amount if the maximum number of entities allowed in the area is reached.

        Returns:
        The count

      • setSpawnCount

        void setSpawnCount(short count)
        Sets the number of monsters that will attempt to spawn in each batch.

        The actual number of monsters spawned may be less than the attempted amount if the maximum number of entities allowed in the area is reached.

        Parameters:
        count - The new count

      • getMaximumNearbyEntities

        short getMaximumNearbyEntities()
        Gets the maximum amount of entities that may be within the spawn range. This monster spawner will cease spawning new entities if this cap is reached.
        Returns:
        The maximum amount of nearby entities

      • setMaximumNearbyEntities

        void setMaximumNearbyEntities(short count)
        Sets the maximum amount of entities that may be within the spawn range. This monster spawner will cease spawning new entities if this cap is reached.
        Parameters:
        count - The new maximum amount of nearby entities

      • getRequiredPlayerRange

        short getRequiredPlayerRange()
        Gets the minimum range to the nearest player before this monster spawner will activate.
        Returns:
        The required range

      • setRequiredPlayerRange

        void setRequiredPlayerRange(short range)
        Sets the minimum range to the nearest player before this monster spawner will activate.
        Parameters:
        range - The new required range

      • getSpawnRange

        short getSpawnRange()
        Gets the range within which the monsters from each batch will be spawned.

        The total region within which the monster may be spawned is defined by a cuboid with dimensions of range*2+1 x 3 x range*2+1 centered around the monster spawner.

        Returns:
        The range

      • setSpawnRange

        void setSpawnRange(short range)
        Sets the range within which the monsters from each batch will be spawned.

        The total region within which the monster may be spawned is defined by a cuboid with dimensions of range*2+1 x 3 x range*2+1 centered around the monster spawner.

        Parameters:
        range - The new range

      • setNextEntityToSpawn

        void setNextEntityToSpawn(EntityType type,
                          @Nullable
                          DataContainer additionalProperties)
        Sets the next entity type and properties to be spawned.
        Parameters:
        type - The entity type
        additionalProperties - Additional properties to apply to the entity, may be null

      • setNextEntityToSpawn

        void setNextEntityToSpawn(WeightedRandomEntity entity)
        Sets the next WeightedRandomEntity to be spawned.
        Parameters:
        entity - The random entity entry

      • getPossibleEntitiesToSpawn

        Collection<WeightedRandomEntity> getPossibleEntitiesToSpawn()
        Gets the collection of WeightedRandomEntity from which the type of each batch of spawned entities will be selected from.
        Returns:
        The possible entities

      • addWeightedEntity

        Optional<WeightedRandomEntity> addWeightedEntity(EntityType entityType,
                                                 int weight,
                                                 Collection<DataManipulator<?>> additionalProperties)
        Creates a WeightedRandomEntity with the given properties and returns the WeightedRandomEntity if validation passed.

        If there is invalid data, either the entity type, the weight, or the additional properties are not valid to apply to the entity, the WeightedRandomEntity is not created.

        Parameters:
        entityType - The entity type
        weight - The weight of the priority to spawn the entity
        additionalProperties - Any additional properties customizing the entity
        Returns:
        The weighted entity if it was created

      • removeWeightedEntity

        void removeWeightedEntity(WeightedRandomEntity weightedEntity)
        Removes the given WeightedRandomEntity from the possible entities to spawn by the mob spawner.
        Parameters:
        weightedEntity - The weighted entity to remove

      • setPossibleEntitiesToSpawn

        void setPossibleEntitiesToSpawn(WeightedRandomEntity... entities)
        Defines a number of WeightedRandomEntitys from which the type of each batch will be randomly selected based on the weighting value.
        Parameters:
        entities - The possible entities

      • setPossibleEntitiesToSpawn

        void setPossibleEntitiesToSpawn(Collection<WeightedRandomEntity> entities)
        Defines a number of WeightedRandomEntitys from which the type of each batch will be randomly selected based on the weighting value.
        Parameters:
        entities - The possible entities
